Class FP_Growth

  • java.lang.Object
    • tree_fp.FP_Growth

  • public class FP_Growth
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Poojitha, Snehal, Sandeep AIM: Applying FP Tree and FP Growth algorithm to generate Association rules.

        A global Hash map of treeset of integers and integer to store the frequent item sets with their supports.

      • confidentRules

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.util.ArrayList<java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer>>,java.lang.Double> confidentRules
        A global Hash map of array list of tree set of integers and double to store the LHS and RHS of a rule with its confidence.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • generateItemsets

        public void generateItemsets(tree_fp.FP_Tree tree,
                             int endWith,
                             int minsup,
                             int[] support,
                             java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer> subSet,
                             java.util.ArrayList<tree_fp.FP_Tree> startNode)
        Parameters:
        tree - The main tree whose subtree(ending with a specified item) has to be generated
        endWith - The item with which every path in the subtree should end
        minsup - Minimum Support
        support - The integer array containing the support of all the elements
        subSet - Candidate frequent itemset which is appended to create a frequent itemset
        startNode - An array containing the ending node of all items. This function recursively finds all the frequent itemsets ending with a particular item by creating a subtree, then pruning it to create a conditional FP Tree. It then adds the frequent itemset to the Hashmap itemWithSupport.

      • confidentRuleGen

        public static void confidentRuleGen(double minConf)
        Parameters:
        minConf - The Confidence threshold below which any rule would be pruned out for not having sufficient confidence This function sends every possible candidate rule of all frequent itemsets to the function isConfRule()

      • isConfRule

        public static void isConfRule(java.util.Map.Entry<java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer>,java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer>> e,
                              double minConf)
        Parameters:
        e - The Rule in the set format whose confidence is to be tested
        minConf - The Confidence threshold below which any rule would be pruned out for not having sufficient confidence This function checks the confidence of each rule and adds only those rules to the global variable : confidentRules who have confidence more than the minimum threshold This function also prints all these rules in sentence format by referencing the DataRef Class

      • powerSet

        public static java.util.Set<java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> powerSet(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> originalSet)
        Parameters:
        originalSet - The Set of which we have to find all the possible Sub sets
        Returns:
        All the possible sub sets of the given Set including null set and the set itself

      • candidatesForConfidence

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer>,java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer>> candidatesForConfidence(java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.Integer> rule)
        Parameters:
        rule - The set currently under consideration
        Returns:
        Returns the possible candidates for confidence pruning. Eliminates Null gives all and vice versa rules.
